item.title: Loschmidt's Paradox
item.description: $$ \def\G{{\bf \Gamma}} \def\bm#1{{\bf #1}} $$ Why do waves never build a sandcastle on the sea? This is the essence of the problem of irreversibility - there is nothing in the equations of motion that disallow it because the underlying physics is symmetric under a change in the direction of time. How do we get a universe with a definitive arrow of time from fundamental physics without one? This is the question I will try to answer in this essay.
